Karpas beckons with kilometers of sandy beaches, plains covered with emerald greenery. Not only that, green spaces consisting of olive trees. Farmers have lived here for centuries in small cozy villages, working on the generous black soil.
Features of Karpas
The area is not particularly burdened with transport interchanges or rich well-thought-out infrastructure. But here is the richest flora and fauna. The Golden Sands beach is recognized as one of the best and most environmentally friendly in the world.
Tourists are burnt by six kilometers of sand dunes with a perfectly clean coastline. The beach was chosen not only by connoisseurs of cleanliness and virgin nature, but also by the Loggerhead sea turtles. They love to lay their eggs here.
Special sights
They say about the peninsula that time has stopped here. Undoubtedly, looking at some of the sights, you can really think so. In summer, locals leave for ceremonies to take a break from everyday life and hustle and bustle.
Housing in elite complex  Northern Cyprus!
The most extreme point of the eastern part of Karpas became the location of the monastery of the Apostle Andrew. At all times, travelers came to the island for peace and solitude, and a nearby source with healing water also made people healthy. Northern Cyprus!

Northern Cyprus
North Cyprus is an island that has attracted the attention of many due to its strategic, political, commercial and religious aspects. And also, who managed to maintain its charm throughout its history.
Northern Cyprus is the birthplace of the first civilization – a Neolithic settlement;
– the location of the kingdoms of ancient cities, reflecting all the splendor of the era of the Roman Empire;
– a place of shelter during the era of the Crusades;
– the most magnificent country of the rule of the representatives of the French dynasty Lusignan;
– strategically important eastern port for Venetian traders;
– the most powerful fortress of the Ottomans in the Eastern Mediterranean;
– there is a port fortress, which inspired the famous English writer William Shakespeare to create the tragedy “Othello”;
– here is the castle of St. Hilarion, which inspired the famous creator of cartoon characters Walt Disney and became the scene of the “Sleeping Beauty”;
– the island is home to the greatest monuments of Gothic art in the Eastern Mediterranean.

property name: SA-138 Apartment in new modern building
property descp:
Description

Apartment in new modern building from Veles Property.
In the center of Girne, another new project is being completed in a modern stylish 5-room building.
First of all, the building is very conveniently located in the city center. Of course, any important point can be reached on foot in 5 minutes.

– thirdly, double glazing
– double glazed doors
– free Internet zone and satellite dishes
– modern elevators
– intercom system
Moreover, a closed parking lot is also provided for the residents of the building.
Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne) is a city in Northern Cyprus. After the Turkish aggression in 1974, it is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus. Located on the northern coast of the island, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains. In addition, there are two versions of the origin of the name of the city: by the name of Aphrodite – “Cyreniana”, or from the name of one of the Greek mountains.
Kyrenia landmarks
Kyrenia harbor is the most picturesque place in Kyrenia. Apart from this, it is a small harbor for fishing boats and small yachts. Also, the former buildings of trade and customs services were occupied by restaurants and small hotels.
Kyrenia fortress – founded in the 7th century by the Byzantines to protect against Arab pirates, rebuilt by the French in the 12th-13th centuries. And then the Venetians in the 15th century. The fortress is currently open to tourists. In general, one of the most amazing museums is located here – the shipwreck museum. The main pride of the museum is the ship’s hull of the 4th century BC, found in 1969 near the port, until recently – the oldest in the world (in 2018, an older ship was discovered off the coast of Greece). As a result, judging by the absence of traces of crew members and expensive goods on the ship, it was attacked by pirates, plundered and flooded.
Apartment in new modern building will pleasantly surprise you.

Northern Cyprus
Located in the Eastern Mediterranean, the island of Cyprus is 64 km from Turkey, 96 km from Syria and 400 km from Egypt. Cyprus is the third largest island in the Mediterranean after Sicily and Sardinia. Due to its strategic, commercial, religious and intercontinental position. Cyprus has been home to many civilizations for several centuries. In Northern Cyprus, with an area of ​​3 355 km2, you can see monuments of historical and cultural heritage that have witnessed a ten-century past. 8000 BC. e. is the beginning of human life on the island. Among the civilizations that have left their traces on the island, from the Neolithic era to the present day, one can distinguish the Phoenicians, Assyrians, Egyptians, Ptolemeians, Persians, Romans, Byzantines.
Every moment spent in Northern Cyprus, stretching from the village of Yeshilyrmak in the west to the monastery of the Apostle Andrew in the east, will make your life unforgettable.
If you love nature, you can enjoy orchids, endemic to flora and fauna. And also, the endless sandy shores of the island. Moreover, you will be able to observe the specially protected turtles, the beauty of the nature of Northern Cyprus with a huge variety of plants. The hospitable inhabitants of the island will greet you with a smile on their face and provide you with all the necessary assistance.

property descp:
Description

1 + 1 Apartment in a new project in Iskele in Northern Cyprus.
A new project has begun in the heart of Long Beach. First of all, this house is located practically on the seashore. Of course, the excellent quality of the construction project speaks of the serious intentions of the developer. Who wants to firmly establish themselves in the territory of Northern Cyprus. In addition, the very design of the house will grab your attention without words. Moreover, a breathtaking panoramic view opens from the windows of each apartment.
The complex has a swimming pool. As well as covered parking. The building has 7 floors. As a result, we get 32 ​​apartments of different cladding. For example, 1 + 1, 2 + 1 and loft.
In addition, you will be surprised by the wonderful location
Firstly, 1 minute from the seashore
Secondly, 3 minutes to the central road Gazimagos-Karpaz Anayolu
Third, 10 minutes to the historical ruins of Salamis
15 minutes to the center of Famagusta
15 minutes to the University
45 minutes to Ercan airport
The ancient city of Salamis (Salamis) is one of the most important sights of Northern Cyprus. It is sometimes even said that the history of Salamis is the history of Cyprus. Ancient harmony frozen in marble literally mesmerizes tourists. You can wander around the ruins of Salamis for more than one day, and there is no doubt that they keep many secrets and treasures.
Let’s plunge into history
For many centuries Salamis played a leading role in the political. Economic and cultural life of ancient Cyprus. Most scientists are inclined to believe that during the Trojan War on the coast of the Gulf of Famagusta, a trading post of the Achaeans was founded. Around 1100 BC, a large-scale invasion of the Achaean Greeks began in Cyprus, who took the capital Alasia by storm. The inhabitants of the destroyed city moved to the trading settlement of the Achaeans on the shores of the bay. This was the beginning of the development of Salamis.
The mention of Salamis in historical documents appears only in the 7th century BC. At this time, the Assyrians invaded the island. The importance of Salamis in the political life of the island grew. In 538, King Eleuton II already minted his own coin – the first Cyprus coin known to scientists. The inscription on it is made in the language of the ethno-Cypriots, which has not yet been deciphered.

property descp:
Description

Two bedroom apartment resale in Northern Cyprus,
The apartment is located literally on the central street Salamis.

10 minutes drive to EMU.
30 minutes to Ercan airport.
35 minutes drive to Nicosia.
In addition, 45 minutes drive to the center of Nicosia.
Famagusta city. Northern Cyprus
Famagusta is “lucky” with its names. For example, the Greeks call this city Ammochostos (Αμμόχωστος), the Turks – Magosa or Gazimagusa. Therefore, on the signs, the city can be called completely differently, depending on which side of Cyprus you will drive up from, but not Famagusta.
Famagusta fortress
The old town is surrounded by a fortress wall. Of course, if you want to walk along the wall, then to get around it, you have to “wind” more than three kilometers. The height of the fortress walls reaches 15-17 meters, and the width is 5-9 meters. From above, the fortress looks like an irregular rectangle. Its walls have survived many earthquakes. And also, artillery shelling, but perfectly preserved.
The Lusignans were the first to build the fortifications of Famagusta. The Venetians significantly rebuilt the fortress – it was already necessary to take into account the artillery that had appeared by that time.
We leave the car and head towards a huge building, which is clearly visible from the parking lot. As a result, this is the main attraction of Famagusta – the Cathedral of St. Nicholas, and now the Lala Mustafa Pasha mosque.

Gonyeli is a city and municipality in the north of Cyprus, in the region of Levkosha. It is located near the capital of the republic — Nicosia. Undoubtedly, it is controlled by a partially recognized state — the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.
Since the Ottoman period, the city has been inhabited mainly by Turks. During the Cyprus crisis in 1963-1975, the city became as a reception center for Turkish refugees from the surrounding villages, oppressed by the Greeks.
And also, Gönyeli was the place of deployment of a part of the Turkish regiment, which was located on the island in accordance with the treaties of 1959-1960.
Also a football club
In addition, the football club Gönyeli Spor Kulübü is based in this city.
Every July, the city center hosts the Gonyeli International Folk Dance Festival. This festival lasts one week, with groups of dancers from countries such as Bulgaria, Romania and Turkey.
The city is popular with students, as it is located near the Middle East University in Nicosia, and many students rent accommodation in Gonyeli.
In general, the suburb is constantly growing. As a consequence, in 2020, the government of Northern Cyprus decided to start building a new bridge. This project should help solve the problems with empty traffic in Nicosia. The width of the bridge will make up 20 meters. There also the four lanes for cars, two sidewalks for pedestrians will be built.

property descp:
Description

Apartment in a new house with infrastructure from Veles Property.
Excellent Northern Cyprus Property For Sale!
One bedroom apartments in a new and modern building in the center of Kyrenia.

– of course fitted wardrobes in all bedrooms

– double glazing
– not only that, the doors are double glazed
– closed parking
– connection for wireless internet and satellite dishes
– modern elevators
– intercom system
The apartment, literally, with a magnificent panoramic view of the sea and the city!
Kyrenia
Undoubtedly, the most popular city in Northern Cyprus is the amazing city of Kyrenia. The very area on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea and surrounded by mountains is conducive to relaxation. The atmosphere in the resort town is always calm. Namely, you will not see skyscrapers here, since it is prohibited to build high-rise buildings. Tourists come here every year for the clean beaches covered with soft sand and the gentle sea. In addition to beach holidays, the most active guests of the city like to visit local attractions.
The first inhabitants on the territory of the modern resort appeared almost six thousand years BC. He founded the city of Cepheus, who was born in Arcadia. For the first time in the documents about Kyrenia, records appeared during the reign of Pharaoh Ramses III. Certainly when it became the main center of trade by sea between Asia Minor and Greece. During the reign of the Roman Empire, which began to include Kyrenia. In this time she managed to maintain its significance as a trade center. In the ninety-fifth year of the fourth century, the Cypriot town became part of Byzantium. Where its importance was not only preserved, but also strengthened in the political sphere.
Historical reference
Throughout the entire period of its existence, the city developed, fortifications were built, But they failed to protect the territory from the Ottoman Turks. They attacked Cyprus in the 71st year of the sixteenth century. The fortification was taken. As a result, all local residents were evicted to the surrounding lands. In the second half of the nineteenth century, the territory of Kyrenia was ruled by the British. New roads, schools, several hospitals, clubs and even the first hotels were built. In general, when the war broke out between the Greeks and the Turks, the city lost its commercial significance. Since then and until now, tourism has become the main profit.

It is the large number of tourists in summer and students in winter. That make this complex extremely attractive for investment.
Famagusta history
For the first time, the city of Famagusta is mentioned in historical materials as Arsinoe in the 3rd century BC.
According to the chronicle, it was built by Ptolemy II during the reign of the Greek dynasty of the Ptolemies in Egypt and Cyprus.
The city grew slowly, and the local population actively mastered agriculture. Besides fishing and various crafts. So, practically for 15 centuries, it has become a leading trade and agricultural nucleus. A sea hub between the major cities of the island and the countries of the entire Mediterranean.
In 1190-1191, during a strong storm, the ships of the Crusaders, led by Richard the Lionheart, were wrecked off the coast of Famagusta.
The then ruler of Cyprus, Isaac Comnenus, instead of giving a helping hand, treated the victims very cruelly. Because of which he later paid a lot.
However, the answer was not long in coming. In 1192, Richard attacked the island. Captured Famagusta and Nicosia, took Comnenus prisoner, and declared himself the new ruler of Cyprus. However, not long after sitting on the throne, Richard the Lionheart sold the island to the Knights Templar. And those soon became the Lusignans, who turned the country into the Kingdom of Cyprus ..
An apartment as an investment is your passive income!

Briefly about the history of Famagusta
The city was founded by the king of Hellenistic Egypt Ptolemy II at the beginning of the 3rd century BC. a few kilometers from the most ancient city of Cyprus – Salamis. Ptolemy II received the nickname Philodelphus (Πτολεμαῖος Φιλάδελφος), which means “loving sister”, after he married his sister Arsinoe. In honor of her, the new city was named Arsinoe.
For a long time Arsinoe looked more like a small fishing village than a city. Only in the 7th century, after the destruction by the Arabs of neighboring Salamis, which at that time was already called Constantia, settlers began to arrive in it. Gradually, Arsinoe turned from a “village” into a small port city, which was named Ammochostos, which translated from Greek means “lost in the sands”. The Greeks themselves still call it that.
History
The key moment for the city was 1192, when Cyprus passed into the hands of the Lusignan, who continued the renaming, calling the city Famagusta. It was with the arrival of the Lusignans that the city began to develop rapidly. And soon it becomes a full-fledged city. Famagusta is starting to play an increasing role in the Eastern Mediterranean. And the most rapid development of Famagusta began in 1291 – after the fall of Tire and Acre and the departure of the crusaders from the Holy Land, Christian settlers from Palestine poured into the city. Subsequently, Famagusta passed into the hands of the Genoese, and then the Venetians. Remaining the only major port between Europe and Asia, Famagusta flourished thanks to active trade.
Merchants and shipowners of that time were drowning in luxury, but they did not forget about the city either. It was believed that the wealth of the city can be estimated by the number of churches in it. So, according to this indicator, Famagusta was one of the leaders. “City of 365 churches” – so they once spoke of her.

Salamis
The ancient city of Salamis (Salamis) is one of the most important sights of Northern Cyprus.. It is sometimes even said that the history of Salamis is the history of Cyprus. Ancient harmony frozen in marble literally mesmerizes tourists. You can wander around the ruins of Salamis for more than one day. And there is no doubt that they keep many secrets and treasures.
For many centuries Salamis played a leading role in the political, economic and cultural life of ancient Cyprus. Most scholars are inclined to believe that during the Trojan War on the coast of the Gulf of Famagusta. A trading post of the Achaean Greeks was founded. Around 1100 BC, a large-scale invasion of the Achaean Greeks began in Cyprus, who took the capital Alasia by storm. The inhabitants of the destroyed city moved to the trading settlement of the Achaeans on the shores of the bay. This was the beginning of the development of Salamis.
The mention of Salamis in historical documents appears only in the 7th century BC. At this time, the Assyrians invaded the island. The importance of Salamis in the political life of the island grew. In 538, King Eleuton II already minted his own coin – the first Cyprus coin known to scientists. The inscription on it is made in the language of the ethno-Cypriots, which has not yet been deciphered.

Richard the Lionheart, Kings of Cyprus and the Jealous Commandant
On May 1, 1191, the fleet of the English Crusader King Richard the Lionheart, heading from Rhodes to Accra, was caught in a storm. Of the four ships washed ashore, one survived, but its passengers – the king’s sister and bride – became prisoners of the usurper of Cyprus Isaac Comnenus.
Of course, Richard’s answer was symmetrical: he took over the island. Undoubtedly, having waited for the emperor to leave him for a while. After that, for many years, until the end of the XIII century, Cyprus remained in the possession of the Crusaders.
In addition, during the Turkish rule, the Cathedral of St. Nicholas was renamed the Lala Mustafa Pasha Mosque.
Famagusta became a significant settlement in Cyprus only at the end of the 13th century, with the fall of the Christian kingdoms of Palestine.
Moreover, it was thanks to the exodus of the Crusaders that Famagusta soon became a city where those who still dreamed of returning to the Holy Land settled.
Hopes were in vain, but Famagusta turned into a rich trading port, protected by a formidable fortress.
From 1328 to 1374 representatives of the Lusignan dynasty, nominally considered the kings of Jerusalem, and in fact – the kings of Cyprus – were crowned in the Cathedral of St. Nicholas in Famagusta.
It was so interesting …
In 1374, Famagusta was annexed by Genoa, which won the war with Cyprus. The Lusignan dynasty died out in 1489. After which, according to the will of the widow of the last king, Catherine Cornaro, Cyprus passed to Venice.
Rumor has it that the story of a jealous husband and his wife. This happened here in 1508. Formed the basis of Shakespeare’s tragedy “Othello”
In 1505, Cristoforo Moro was appointed commandant of the fortress and castle of Famagusta. Which also became Venetian. The fortress has already been renovated. And the castle has been rebuilt in the Renaissance style.
In addition, according to legend, from one of its towers in 1508, the commandant Moreau threw the body of his murdered wife. Suspected by him of infidelity, and then committed suicide. This dark story formed the basis of Shakespeare’s tragedy “Othello”.

Northern Cyprus
Throughout its history, the island has had such names as Alashia, Kitty, Yadnana, Hittami. However, the most common theory is that the name of the island comes from the word “Cuprumm, Cyprium”, which means copper, which prevails on the island.
With olive, carob, cypress and pine trees and green vegetation, Northern Cyprus is beautiful at any time of the year. The vegetation of Northern Cyprus, which has fertile soil, appears before us in different colors at every season. Citrus fruits such as oranges, lemons, tangerines, and grapefruits are grown on the island. Also, watermelons, potatoes and other vegetables and fruits. The coastal strip is covered with eucalyptus and acacias. While in the mountainous areas, fragrant conifers grow.
Northern Cyprus has a healthy Mediterranean climate. Summers are long and hot. On the other hand, winter is short. Moreover, such concepts as cold wind, cold and snow are not familiar to Northern Cyprus. Precipitation falls mainly in the form of rain. However, very rarely in the mountainous area, in the vicinity of the city of Kyrenia, snow falls, which immediately melts.

Iskele
Iskele is the administrative center of the region of the same name located on the Karpas Peninsula.
The main attraction of this Turkish settlement is its nature. In particular, the mountains and the clear sea are beautiful. The coastline of Iskele stretches for 25 kilometers and all this space is occupied by the best Northern Cyprus beaches covered with fine sand. As a result, the beaches of Iskele are notable for the lack of a large crowd of tourists, even during the high season.
to buy not an expensive apartment in Cyprus, veles

Iskele is also famous for a large number of places of interest. Namely, in the very center of the village stands a picturesque 15th century church named after St. Yakov. Also, at one time, many findings belonging to antiquity were made on the territory of the settlement, including statues dating from the 6-5 centuries BC. As a result, some of which are now kept in the best museums in the world.
Another unique monument of Iskele is the Church of the Virgin Mary built in the 12th century; today its premises are occupied by a unique museum of icons. Walking around the village and relaxing on clean beaches is not all that you can afford while relaxing in this resort. In general, the surroundings of Iskele are also rich in all kinds of ancient monuments and natural objects worthy of attention.

Iskele
Iskele is the administrative center of the region of the same name located on the Karpas Peninsula.
The main attraction of this Turkish settlement is its nature. In particular, the mountains and the clear sea. The coastline of Iskele stretches for 25 kilometers and all this space is occupied by the best Cypriot beaches covered with fine sand. As a result, the beaches of Iskele are distinguished by the absence of a large crowd of tourists, even during the high season.
Iskele is also famous for a large number of attractions. Namely, in the very center of the village there is a picturesque 15th century church named after St. Jacob. Also, at one time, many finds belonging to antiquity were made on the territory of the settlement, including statues dating from the 6-5 centuries BC. As a result, some of which are now kept in the best museums in the world. Another unique monument of Iskele is the Church of the Virgin Mary built in the 12th century; today its premises are occupied by a unique museum of icons. Walking around the village and relaxing on clean beaches is not all that you can afford while relaxing in this resort. In general, the surroundings of Iskele are also rich in all kinds of ancient monuments and natural sites worthy of attention.

Moreover, a closed parking lot is also provided for the residents of the building.
Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne) is a city in Cyprus. After the Turkish aggression in 1974, it is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus.. Located on the northern coast of the island, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains. In addition, there are two versions of the origin of the name of the city: by the name of Aphrodite – “Cyreniana”, or from the name of one of the Greek mountains.
Kyrenia landmarks
Kyrenia harbor is the most picturesque place in Kyrenia. Apart from this, it is a small harbor for fishing boats and small yachts. Also, the former buildings of trade and customs services were occupied by restaurants and small hotels.
Kyrenia fortress – founded in the 7th century by the Byzantines to protect against Arab pirates, rebuilt by the French in the 12th-13th centuries. And then the Venetians in the 15th century. The fortress is currently open to tourists. In general, one of the most amazing museums is located here – the shipwreck museum. The main pride of the museum is the ship’s hull of the 4th century BC, found in 1969 near the port, until recently – the oldest in the world (in 2018, an older ship was discovered off the coast of Greece). As a result, judging by the absence of traces of crew members and expensive goods on the ship, it was attacked by pirates, plundered and flooded.
Apartment 2 + 1 in the center of Girne will pleasantly surprise you.

Tuzla
The settlement of Engomi (Enkomi) or Tuzla, even older than Salamis and arose in 1850-1650 BC, at a time when Cypriots learned to smelt bronze. In addition, rich copper deposits were found on the island. In general, the island began to trade with other Mediterranean countries. One of the copper deposits, for example, was located near Engomi. The area was also home to Cypriot cedar, which was exported abroad. As a result, at the end of the XIV century, Engomi was surrounded by a powerful wall, and a necropolis was built nearby. Archaeologists have discovered many intact tombs with jewelry, weapons, copper, silver and gold products. Some of these items were covered in Egyptian hieroglyphs.

Northern Cyprus
Throughout its history, the island has had such names as Alashia, Kitty, Yadnana, Hittami. However, the most common theory is that the name of the island comes from the word “Cuprumm, Cyprium”, which means copper, which prevails on the island.
With olive, carob, cypress and pine trees and green vegetation, Northern Cyprus is beautiful at any time of the year. The vegetation of Northern
Cyprus, which has fertile soil, appears before us in different colors at every season. Citrus fruits such as oranges, lemons, tangerines, and grapefruits are grown on the island. Also, watermelons, potatoes and other vegetables and fruits. The coastal strip is covered with eucalyptus and acacias. While in the mountainous areas, fragrant conifers grow.
Northern Cyprus has a healthy Mediterranean climate. Summers are long and hot. On the other hand, winter is short. Moreover, such concepts as cold wind, cold and snow are not familiar to Northern Cyprus. Precipitation falls mainly in the form of rain. However, very rarely in the mountainous area, in the vicinity of the city of Kyrenia, snow falls, which immediately melts.

property descp:
Description

Apartment 2 + 1 in a new elite building from Veles Property.
Excellent North Cyprus Property For Sale!
Two-bedroom apartments in a new and modern building in the center of Kyrenia.
So, the features of the apartments: – of course, built-in closets in all bedrooms – ceramic tiles or laminate. Flooring – double glazed windows – not only that. Double glazed doors – closed parking – wireless internet. Satellite antennas – modern elevators – intercom system. The apartment, literally , with a magnificent panoramic view of the sea and the city!
Kyrenia
Undoubtedly, the most popular city in Northern Cyprus is the amazing city of Kyrenia. The very area on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea and surrounded by mountains is conducive to relaxation. The atmosphere in the resort town is always calm. Namely, you will not see skyscrapers here, since it is prohibited to build high-rise buildings. Tourists come here every year for the sake of clean beaches. Its covered with soft sand and gentle sea. The most active guests of the city like to visit local attractions.
Very interesting about
The first inhabitants on the territory of the modern resort appeared almost six thousand years BC. He founded the city of Cepheus, who was born in Arcadia. For the first time in the documents about Kyrenia, records appeared during the reign of Pharaoh Ramesses the Third. Certainly, it happened when it became the main center of trade by sea between Asia Minor and Greece. During the reign of the Roman Empire, which began to include Kyrenia, it managed to maintain its importance as a shopping center. In the ninety-fifth year of the fourth century, the Cypriot town became part of Byzantine. Where its importance was not only preserved, but also strengthened in the political sphere.
Throughout the entire period of its existence, the city developed. Fortification fortresses were built, but they did not protect the territory from the Ottoman Turks. Who attacked Cyprus in the 71st year of the sixteenth century. The fortification was taken. As a result, all local residents were evicted to the surrounding lands. In the second half of the nineteenth century, the territory of Kyrenia was ruled by the British. New roads, schools, several hospitals, clubs and even the first hotels were built. In general, when the war broke out between the Greeks and the Turks, the city lost its commercial significance. Since then and until now, tourism makes up the main part of the profit.

Away from the hustle and bustle, but in the center of the city, next to the popular market, a unique complex is being built.

Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne is a city in Cyprus. Nevertheless, after the Turkish aggression in 1974. It is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus.  It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus. Located on the north coast of the island. Moreover, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains.
The settlement on the site of modern Kyrenia arose in the 10th century BC, although the most ancient archaeological finds date back to 5800 BC. According to the legend, the city was founded by the legendary Kefey (Cepheus) – one of the Argonauts, the husband of Cassiopeia and the father of Andromeda, after whom the constellation is named. The first written mention goes back to Ramses III – Kyrenia is listed as one of the city-states of Cyprus.
The most powerful city on the island was Salamis. Kyrenia, along with the neighboring city of Lambusa (Lafetos), has become a major center of trade with Asia Minor and Greece. The era of the Roman Empire and after its division, in the Byzantine period (from 395), was the time of prosperity for Kyrenia: a large trading port and a Kyrenian fortress were built. It is to this era that the famous Kyrenian ship sunk near the coast belongs.

Iskele
Iskele is the administrative center of the region of the same name located on the Karpas Peninsula.
The main attraction of this Turkish settlement is its nature. In particular, the mountains and the clear sea. The coastline of Iskele stretches for 25 kilometers and all this space is occupied by the best Cypriot beaches covered with fine sand. As a result, the beaches of Iskele are notable for their lack of crowds of tourists, even in the high season. Iskele is also famous for a large number of attractions.
Namely, in the very center of the village there is a picturesque 15th century church named after St. Jacob. Also, at one time, many finds belonging to antiquity were made on the territory of the settlement. Iincluding statues dating back to the 6-5 centuries BC. As a result, some of which are now kept in the best museums in the world. Another unique monument of Iskele is the Church of the Virgin Mary built in the 12th century; today its premises are occupied by a unique museum of icons. Walking around the village and relaxing on clean beaches is not all that you can afford while relaxing in this resort. In general, the surroundings of Iskele are also rich in all kinds of ancient monuments and natural sites worthy of attention.

Northern Cyprus
Throughout its history, the island has had such names as Alashia, Kitty, Yadnana, Hittami. However, the most common theory is that the name of the island comes from the word “Cuprumm, Cyprium”, which means copper, which prevails on the island.
With olive, carob, cypress and pine trees and green vegetation, Northern Cyprus is beautiful at any time of the year. The vegetation of Northern Cyprus, which has fertile soil, appears before us in different colors at every season. Citrus fruits such as oranges, lemons, tangerines, and grapefruits are grown on the island. Also, watermelons, potatoes and other vegetables and fruits. The coastal strip is covered with eucalyptus and acacias. While in the mountainous areas, fragrant conifers grow.
Northern Cyprus has a healthy Mediterranean climate. Summers are long and hot. On the other hand, winter is short. Moreover, such concepts as cold wind, cold and snow are not familiar to Northern Cyprus. Precipitation falls mainly in the form of rain. However, very rarely in the mountainous area, in the vicinity of the city of Kyrenia, snow falls, which immediately melts.

From empires to republic
The Famagusta fortress in Cyprus is famous not only for the Othello tower, but also for the heroic defense in 1570-71, during the siege of the city by the troops of the Turkish Sultan Selim II.
The siege lasted 10 months, but the forces were clearly unequal and the Venetians had to surrender the city.
One of the conditions for surrender was the unhindered exit of the surviving soldiers from Famagusta. Lala Mustafa Pasha, the commander of the Turkish army that was besieging the fortress, agreed to these conditions, but did not keep his promise.
It is worth noting that until recently Famagusta was one of the most fashionable resorts in the Mediterranean.
Turkey owned Cyprus until 1878. In Famagusta, the southern coastal region of Varosha was assigned to the Greeks. Unfortunately, Orthodox and Latin churches have become mosques.
The Cathedral of St. Nicholas (now the Lala Mustafa Pasha Mosque) also became a mosque, but most Greek Cypriots continued to secretly practice Christian rites.
From 1878 to 1960 Cyprus was a British colony, but the Turks and Greeks still lived separately.
Cyprus gained independence in 1960, while both communities retained full self-government.
This made it possible to start developing the tourism business. Famagusta in Northern Cyprus, has become one of the most prestigious resorts. Among her guests were Brigitte Bardot and Elizabeth Taylor with Richard Burton.
In the Varosha district, a full-scale construction of hotels was launched on the first line, and on the second – next to colonial-style houses – new villas appeared …

Northern Cyprus nature
The flora of the island of Cyprus numbers approximately 1900 units. It is worth noting that approximately 1,500 of which are native to Northern Cyprus. The Mediterranean climate and literally more than 300 days of sunshine a year have been an important factor in the emergence of such natural wealth on the island. Among the plants growing in North Cyprus, there are 19 endemic units and 32 varieties of wild orchids.
In this regard, these plants can be found only here. Moreover, only one species of wild orchid growing in North Cyprus called Orchid Kotschyi is recognized as endemic to this island. Another endemic to Cyprus, however, is Tulipa Cypria, a Cypriot tulip, which is also honored with a festival in the villages of Tepebashi and Avtepe in March. Moreover, all varieties of orchids, commemorative trees, endemics and rare species, which are the rarest valuable units of flora and fauna, are protected.

property name: SA-370 THREE BEDROOM APARTMENT IN GIRNE
property descp:
Description

Three-bedroom apartment for sale in the town of Girne. First of all, this property attracts with its location. Undoubtedly, this is the center of the city of Girne, walking distance to cafes, markets, and any institutions.
Despite the interior of this apartment, it is sold unfurnished and without household appliances.
In addition, there is a three-bedroom apartment in the town of Girne on the third floor of a three-storey building. Undoubtedly due to this, large balconies adjoin this apartment from all sides. Two of which are glazed and join the rooms. Due to this, an additional spacious dressing room and a cozy study-library appeared.
Of course, the house has a parking lot, which is calculated for one parking space for each apartment. There is also a swimming pool at the disposal of the residents.
City

Girne (Kyrenia) is a famous historical city of Cyprus, just a paradise for vacationers. Certainly blue skies, yellow beach sand, azure waters, hospitable locals – all this characterizes Girne. Moreover, citrus and olive trees grow on the outskirts of the city.
The sea coasts are of extraordinary beauty here. Of course, there are many attractions in Girne, for example, the Kyrenia fortress. It is believed that the fortress was built to protect the city from Arab raids in the 7th century. In addition, the fortress consists of several parts. As a result, tourists admire the Venetian towers and the guardroom. As well as a large hall, an underground dungeon and rooms that were used for warehouses, a reservoir, stocks of weapons, a cannon parapet, a museum of sunken ships.
Historic Harbor Girne is the heart of the city and is always full of ships and yachts day and night. The many restaurants and hotels in Harbor are packed with tourists.
The locals are friendly and welcoming. Kyrenia’s mild Mediterranean climate determines relatively warm weather in winter and hot in summer. Life in Girne is measured and safe. Officially, fifty thousand people live in the city.
The culture of the city is reflected in the national cuisine, handicrafts and traditions.
There is a bazaar in the city on Wednesdays. Here you can buy various goods at affordable prices: fresh vegetables, fruits, homemade cheese, nuts, handicrafts, carpets, inexpensive clothing, and more.
You should have viewed a three-bedroom apartment in Girne with Veles Property!

Karaoglanoglu
The settlement of Karaoglanoglu, located 5 kilometers from the city, formerly a small sleepy village, has turned into a sought-after suburb of Kyrenia. After the events of 1974, Ayyorgi was renamed in honor of Colonel Karaoglanoglu, who was one of the first Turkish soldiers to land on the coast of Northern Cyprus.
The settlement is famous for its lemon and olive groves. In recent years, due to the growing popularity of the region from both locals and tourists, five-star hotels and restaurants have been built along the coast. In the area there is a small church of St. Fanurius, which is located on the very seashore. According to legend, the church was built exactly on the spot where Saint Fanurius died, slipping on steep rocks.

Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne) is a city in Cyprus. Nevertheless, after the Turkish aggression in 1974. It is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus. Located on the north coast of the island. Moreover, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains.
The settlement on the site of modern Kyrenia arose in the 10th century BC, although the most ancient archaeological finds date back to 5800 BC. According to legend, the city was founded by the legendary Kefey (Cepheus) – one of the Argonauts, the husband of Cassiopeia and the father of Andromeda, after whom the constellation is named. The first written mention goes back to Ramses III – Kyrenia is listed as one of the city-states of Cyprus.
The most powerful city on the island was Salamis. Kyrenia, along with the neighboring city of Lambusa (Lapetos), has become a major center of trade with Asia Minor and Greece. The era of the Roman Empire and after its division, in the Byzantine period (from 395), was the heyday of Kyrenia: a large trading port and a Kyrenian fortress were built. It is to this era that the famous Kyrenian ship sunk near the coast belongs.

Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne) is a city in Cyprus. After the Turkish aggression in 1974, it is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus.. Located on the northern coast of the island, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains. In addition, there are two versions of the origin of the name of the city: by the name of Aphrodite – “Cyreniana”, or from the name of one of the Greek mountains.
Kyrenia landmarks
Kyrenia harbor is the most picturesque place in Kyrenia. Apart from this, it is a small harbor for fishing boats and small yachts. Also, the former buildings of trade and customs services were occupied by restaurants and small hotels.
Kyrenia fortress – founded in the 7th century by the Byzantines to protect against Arab pirates, rebuilt by the French in the 12th-13th centuries. And then the Venetians in the 15th century. The fortress is currently open to tourists. In general, one of the most amazing museums is located here – the shipwreck museum. The main pride of the museum is the ship’s hull of the 4th century BC, found in 1969 near the port, until recently – the oldest in the world (in 2018, an older ship was discovered off the coast of Greece). As a result, judging by the absence of traces of crew members and expensive goods on the ship, it was attacked by pirates, plundered and flooded.

property descp:
Description

Commercial property in the center of Famagusta with Veles Property in North Cyprus!
Incredible possibilities
A great opportunity for those who are used to investing in a non-residential fund! If you are interested in the option of investing in North Cyprus shops, then this offer will definitely interest you! And also, if you are considering the option of investing in commercial real estate in Northern Cyprus, you should definitely take a closer look at this room. In addition, the payback period for such real estate is 10 years. Therefore, investing in commercial real estate in Northern Cyprus is a long-term project. Moreover, this option is perfect for different types of commercial lease.
If you want to do flowers, open a pharmacy, office, travel agency, this option is very good. If you want to purchase such a property, and then rent it out, the management company itself from the developer will help you with this. The building is being constructed from high quality building and finishing materials, with a moisture-proof roof and foundation!
Owning a property in North Cyprus is like getting the privilege of living and working in a magnificent, mysterious and historical place. Cyprus is an island that has attracted the attention of many due to its strategic, political, commercial and religious aspects! and also managed to maintain its charm throughout its history. The island of Cyprus is one of the most mysterious places on earth. The mysterious nature of Northern Cyprus breathes a Mediterranean aroma! Moreover, Northern Cyprus is the most mysterious representative of history. Here are some of the most magnificent monuments of Gothic art in the Eastern Mediterranean!
Richard the Lionheart, Kings of Cyprus and the Jealous Commandant
On May 1, 1191, the fleet of the English Crusader King Richard the Lionheart, heading from Rhodes to Accra, was caught in a storm. Of the four ships washed ashore, one survived. But its passengers – the king’s sister and bride – became prisoners of the usurper of Cyprus Isaac Comnenus. Of course, Richard’s answer was symmetrical: he took over the island. Undoubtedly, having waited for the emperor to leave him for a while. After that, for many years, until the end of the XIII century, Cyprus remained in the possession of the Crusaders. In addition, during the Turkish rule, the Cathedral of St. Nicholas was renamed the Lala Mustafa Pasha Mosque.
Famagusta became a significant settlement in Cyprus only at the end of the 13th century, with the fall of the Christian kingdoms of Palestine. Moreover, it was thanks to the exodus of the Crusaders that Famagusta soon became a city where those who still dreamed of returning to the Holy Land settled. Hopes were in vain, but Famagusta turned into a rich trading port, protected by a formidable fortress. From 1328 to 1374 representatives of the Lusignan dynasty, nominally considered the kings of Jerusalem. In fact, they were crowned kings of Cyprus in the Cathedral of St. Nicholas in Famagusta.
More about history
In 1374, Famagusta was annexed by Genoa, which won the war with Cyprus. The Lusignan dynasty died out in 1489, after which, according to the will of the widow of the last king, Catherine Cornaro, Cyprus passed to Venice. Rumor has it that the story of a jealous husband and his wife, which happened here in 1508, formed the basis of Shakespeare’s tragedy “Othello” In 1505, Cristoforo Moro was appointed commandant of the fortress and castle of Famagusta, which also became Venetian. The fortress has already been renovated, and the castle has been rebuilt in the Renaissance style.
In addition, according to legend, from one of its towers in 1508, the commandant Moreau threw the body of his murdered wife, suspected by him of infidelity, and then committed suicide. This dark story formed the basis of Shakespeare’s tragedy “Othello”.

CULTURAL AND SOCIAL LIFE OF NORTHERN CYPRUS
First of all, the traditions, customs and social life of Northern Cyprus are very colorful, as are the natural beauties. Social ceremonies such as weddings, circumcisions, and celebrations are very important. As a consequence, the family tradition is to get together and take part in various activities. The feeling of social solidarity is very high. A characteristic feature of the Turkish Cypriot community is the traditional Turkish hospitality known throughout the world. The oldest of the guests is the most respected person and is welcomed in a way that is appreciated by the whole community. The culture of coffee making is very developed. Even if you find yourself in an unfamiliar environment, you will be served coffee. As a result, the culture of food and hospitality is the most distinctive feature of everyday life in North Cyprus.
Grace for your soul
In season, “ice sherbet”, carefully prepared from citrus fruits and lemonade such as lemons and tangerines, is served to guests on the balcony, porch or in the garden of the house in summer. Jams are also served to guests. The presentation of beautiful and delicious jams prepared in a special way requires a special ceremony. Walnut jam is the most valuable delicacy. Served in a small bowl with small forks and a glass of water.
The island is very fond of fruits and fruit preservation. Namely, walnut, watermelon, bergamot, figs, pumpkin, quince paste, orange jam, persimmon jam, grape jam. Also, hawthorn, citrus jam, strawberry jam, plum jam, pear compote, peach compote, harup syrup, apple compote. Undoubtedly, you will also find these delicious desserts in the page’s house.
Ready-made villa from the developer with Veles Property.

property name: SA-2174 Penthouse apartment in luxury building
property descp:
Description

Penthouse apartment in luxury building from Veles Property.
Excellent Northern Cyprus Property For Sale!
Two bedroom apartments in a new and modern building in the center of Kyrenia.
So, the features of the apartments:
– of course fitted wardrobes in all bedrooms
– ceramic tiles or laminate flooring
– double glazing
– not only that, the doors are double glazed
– closed parking
– connection for wireless internet and satellite dishes
– modern elevators
– intercom system
The apartment, literally, with a magnificent panoramic view of the sea and the city!
Kyrenia
Undoubtedly, the most popular city in Northern Cyprus is the amazing city of Kyrenia. The very area on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea and surrounded by mountains is conducive to relaxation. The atmosphere in the resort town is always calm. Namely, you will not see skyscrapers here, since it is prohibited to build high-rise buildings. Tourists come here every year for the clean beaches covered with soft sand and the gentle sea. In addition to beach holidays. And the most active guests of the city like to visit local attractions.
The first inhabitants on the territory of the modern resort appeared almost six thousand years BC. He founded the city of Cepheus, who was born in Arcadia. For the first time in the documents about Kyrenia, records appeared during the reign of Pharaoh Ramses III. Certainly when it became the main center of trade by sea between Asia Minor and Greece. During the reign of the Roman Empire, which began to include Kyrenia. She managed to maintain its significance as a trade center. In the ninety-fifth year of the fourth century, the Cypriot town became part of Byzantium, where its importance was not only preserved, but also strengthened in the political sphere.
History
Throughout the entire period of its existence, the city developed. Also fortifications were built, but they did not protect the territory from the Ottoman Turks, who attacked Cyprus in the 71st year of the sixteenth century. The fortification was taken. As a result, all local residents were evicted to the surrounding lands. In the second half of the nineteenth century, the territory of Kyrenia was ruled by the British. New roads, schools, several hospitals, clubs and even the first hotels were built. In general, when the war broke out between the Greeks and the Turks, the city lost its commercial significance. Since then and until now, tourism has become the main profit.
Penthouse apartment in luxury building with infrastructure for you!

property descp:
Description

Moreover, the project is being built by skilled craftsmen with strong technical background. Here, aesthetics and luxury intersect with a great location. At the same time, with a high level of service and maintenance of this complex.
Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne) is a city in Cyprus. Nevertheless, after the Turkish aggression in 1974, it is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus. Located on the north coast of the island. Moreover, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains.
The settlement on the site of modern Kyrenia dates back to the 10th century BC, although the most ancient archaeological finds date back to 5800 BC. According to legend, the city was founded by the legendary Kefey (Cepheus) – one of the Argonauts, the husband of Cassiopeia and the father of Andromeda, after whom the constellation is named. The first written mention goes back to Ramses III – Kyrenia is listed as one of the city-states of Cyprus.
The most powerful city on the island was Salamis. Kyrenia, along with the neighboring city of Lambusa (Lapetos), has become a major center of trade with Asia Minor and Greece. The era of the Roman Empire and after its division, in the Byzantine period (from 395), was the heyday of Kyrenia: a large trading port and a Kyrenian fortress were built. It is to this era that the famous Kyrenian ship sunk near the coast belongs.

Undoubtedly, all bathrooms, toilets and open areas have 2 layers of cement-based insulation. One on top of minimum layer of concrete with thickness of 8 cm and lower layer.
In addition, all floor terraces, balconies and stairwells are laid out with non-slippery ceramic tiles of light gray color 60 x 120 cm. Moreover, skirting boards with height of 15 cm made of same material are installed in these areas. Single layer of waterproof insulation is used for roof terrace.
Doors and windows:
Undoubtedly, front door will be made of MDF material and painted. First of all, door handles, locks and hinges will be used in Hafele quality or equivalent. And also, all interior doors are American-style. Interior door handles, caps, locks and hinges Hafele quality or equivalent. In addition, all external doors and windows (except front door) are made of comfortable glass for thermal insulation, Sapa or Schüco anthracite color, or similar aluminum, complete with all fasteners and fittings, including locks, handles, felt, etc.
All colors for above materials are determined by construction company. However, all materials used are checked and approved by developer.
Wardrobes in the bedrooms:
Of course, bedroom wardrobes are made of laminated material with wardrobe system. Moreover, their height is to ceiling, and mirror is also attached to one panel. At the same time, color of cabinets is chosen by buyer.
Kitchen:
All kitchen cabinets are made of laminated material. The kitchen has sufficient number of shelves and drawers, as well as a trash can and a shelf for plates. The loops will be internal. Stainless steel sinks with 1 + 1⁄2 bowl. The colors of tabletops and handle boxes are chosen by buyer. Included and fully integrated household appliances, Electrolux brands: dishwasher, washing machine with dryer, oven, induction hob, extractor hood, refrigerator / freezer.
Bathrooms:
Undoubtedly, sink and toilet will be installed properly in accordance with plans and drawings of project. In addition, all toilets are wall-mounted with hidden tank and reservoir. Moreover, all showers of new type with glass door, water mixer, shower, etc. Moreover, all fittings will be first-class chromed type (Grohe or similar). And also, in each bathroom and toilet there will be holder for toilet paper, holder for soap, one long and one short hangers for towels.
Communal pools:
So, in every residential block, except Block D, there is common pool with an infinity effect in front of terrace on ground floor. In accordance with architectural and mechanical designs. In general, the flooring on terrace is made of non-slip ceramic tiles 60 x 120 cm.
Air conditioning:
In each apartment, a VRF cooling and heating system will be installed. Which will cover apartment completely, including bathrooms. The system is selected by construction company.

property name: ST-310 New project against Karpas berth
property descp:
Description

New project against Karpas berth in Northern Cyprus.
This complex is located literally opposite the pier in the village of Yeni Erenokoy.
Certainly designed according to the latest construction and architecture technologies. What’s more, each villa has a private pool. In addition, each house has a spacious rooftop terrace.
A little about the characteristics of the villa
First, there are fitted wardrobes in every bedroom.
Secondly, double-glazed aluminum windows.
Thirdly, the high quality Marbelite cuisine.
Ceramic tiles on the floor.
Air conditioning system for each room.
Amplifier of water pressure (pump).
Central power generator system.
Central satellite system.
Private garden.
Private pool.
Roof terrace.
Sea view.
Parking.
Karpas. Northern Cyprus
The Karpas Peninsula (Karpasia) is a narrow, long segment of land that is now so popular with tourists and locals. Of course, a truly amazing atmosphere reigns here. As a result, among the pristine nature, you can relax and gain strength.
Karpas beckons with kilometers of sandy beaches, plains covered with emerald greenery. Not only that, green spaces consisting of olive trees. Farmers have lived here for centuries in small cozy villages, working on the generous black soil.
Features of Karpas
The area is not particularly burdened with transport interchanges or rich well-thought-out infrastructure. But here is the richest flora and fauna. The Golden Sands beach is recognized as one of the best and most environmentally friendly in the world.
Tourists are burnt by six kilometers of sand dunes with a perfectly clean coastline. The beach was chosen not only by connoisseurs of cleanliness and virgin nature, but also by the Loggerhead sea turtles. They love to lay their eggs here.
Special sights
They say about the peninsula that time has stopped here. Undoubtedly, looking at some of the sights, you might really think so. In summer, locals leave for ceremonies to take a break from everyday life and hustle and bustle.
The most extreme point of the eastern part of Karpas became the location of the monastery of the Apostle Andrew. At all times, travelers came to the island for peace and solitude, and a nearby source with healing water also made people healthy.

property name: SV-352 Spacious villa 3+1 in Chatalkoy
property descp:
Description

Spacious villa 3+1 in Chatalkoy in North Cyprus.
This three bedroom villa is being built using the most modern architectural technologies.
So, the villa includes
Fireplace.
Private pool.
However, there is a large terrace.
Private garden plot.
In addition, parking for two cars.
Separate kitchen area.
Separate dining room.
Large double bed in the master bedroom.
Marble floor.
Moreover, the decor of the ceiling of their plasterboard.
All bathrooms have first-class tiles.
First class double glazed aluminum window system.
Each room has an infrastructure for the Internet, satellite TV and telephone.
The walls and ceilings in the rooms are painted with first class paint.
Laminated interior doors.
Infrastructure for personal surveillance cameras.
Infrastructure for air conditioners.
Roof waterproofing and thermal insulation.
Solar panels on the roof of the house.
There is a place for a barbecue in the yard.
Among other things, a view of the mountains.
Northern Cyprus nature
As a consequence of its location, North Cyprus is a stopover for migratory birds. At different times of the year, mainly in spring and autumn, there are over 370 bird species in Northern Cyprus.
In terms of bird species, this island is the richest area in the entire Mediterranean. In addition, there are over 50 species of butterflies on the island. Moreover, each of which is superior to the other in its beauty.
It is worth noting that the sea turtles are the dignity of the island.
There are two types of sea turtles that prefer the coast of Northern Cyprus for laying their eggs. Namely, the turtle Caretta and the Green Turtle. Moreover, annually more than 200 turtles of both species visit the shores of the island. Undoubtedly, the most favorable time to observe the egg laying is the end of June and the beginning of July. Little turtles are born during August. Mostly at the end of the month or early September.
The most famous beach with turtles is Alagadi. In addition, just 15 minutes from this house.

Kyrenia
Kyrenia or Girne (tour. Girne) is a city in Cyprus. Nevertheless, after the Turkish aggression in 1974, it is located on the territory of the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. It is now considered the tourist center of Northern Cyprus. Located on the north coast of the island. Moreover, at the foot of the Kyrenia Mountains.
The settlement on the site of modern Kyrenia arose in the 10th century BC, although the most ancient archaeological finds date back to 5800 BC. According to legend, the city was founded by the legendary Kefey (Cepheus) – one of the Argonauts, the husband of Cassiopeia and the father of Andromeda, after whom the constellation is named. The first written mention goes back to Ramses III – Kyrenia is listed as one of the city-states of Cyprus.
The most powerful city on the island was Salamis. Kyrenia, along with the neighboring city of Lambusa (Lapetos), has become a major center of trade with Asia Minor and Greece. The era of the Roman Empire and after its division, in the Byzantine period (from 395), was the heyday of Kyrenia: a large trading port and a Kyrenian fortress were built. It is to this era that the famous Kyrenian ship sunk near the coast belongs.
New layout penthouse in the center of Kyrenia for you!

Tatlisu village
The village is located at the foot of the Beshparmak mountains, just 20 minutes east of Girne (Kyrenia) and 30 minutes from Ercan airport. Name of the village is translated from Turkish as “Sweet Water”.
The village is renowned for its unspoiled beauty and boasts some of the most beautiful beaches and coves in Northern Cyprus that you will immediately want to explore.
The Tatlysu settlement itself is a small village with houses built in a traditional style.
Tatlysu has a rich history and is an important archaeological site of the Neolithic period. Flint daggers and the remains of antique columns were found on the beaches of Tatlisu.
From Tatlysu you can see the east coast of Girne (Kyrenia) and the Karpas peninsula. The beauty of the village will delight you! Having visited Tatlysu once, you will certainly come back here!

Water
In addition to the municipal water supply through the meter, the site has its own well. The water from which certainly feeds the entire garden and maintains the level in the pool. Moreover, two containers of 5 tons were buried near the house, one of which is for the needs of the house. In addition, the second for watering the garden. When entering the house, water goes through a coarse cleaning and softening system. Thanks to this, the plumbing does not fail and does not have a deposit. At the same time, there is a fine cleaning system after which you can drink crystal clear water.
Electricity
First of all, 380 volts (3 phases) are brought into the house. For what? Certainly for 10 Kwt solar panels, which generate and send excess electricity to the grid. Thus, accumulating a large supply of electricity for the winter. Due to this, inventory air conditioners operate in the house almost all year round 24/7. Of course, maintaining a constant comfortable temperature. Moreover, in the winter months, a heat pump is switched on (the most efficient heating system). Moreover, he is catching up
emits hot water into the accumulator, provides the house with constantly hot water and warm batteries. Literally all winter, the house is warm and comfortable. But most importantly, using all this, the electricity bills are certainly scanty, less than in a one-room apartment.
Window
The windows are sliding, but not standard inherent in Cypriot apartments. And energy saving, tightly closing with ventilation system.
The guest room on the ground floor has a floor heating system. Throughout the house, fitted wardrobes in every room and hallway. There is a technical room where the equipment for the house is located and it also serves as a workshop. There is a mini gym and a steam room with a “Fitobochka” equipped. Also with a steam generator system with the ability to use herbs for the health of your body.
All bedrooms have parquet and laminate flooring. All interior doors are solid wood. The kitchen is made to order, the most convenient for use. Separate laundry room. Each bedroom has a bathroom. Each floor has spacious terraces with a total area of ​​100 square meters. From where the most gorgeous views of the mountains and the sea open. Most of the furniture will undoubtedly remain with the new owners. The current owners will take with them only the most valuable for them.
The garden around the house deserves special attention. This house is literally buried in greenery, with an evergreen liana wrapping around every wall. Tall trees hide the house from all sides from prying eyes and the scorching sun. Fruit trees, grapes, cactus alley, palms. These are not all plants that can be enjoyed walking in the garden.
Excellent location
The villa itself is located in Alsancak, on the hills of Edermit. Thanks to this, it has gorgeous views of the sea and mountains. At the same time, it is 5 minutes to the nearest beach. And 5 minutes to the market. The city is only 10 minutes away, and the nearest universities are less than 10 minutes away.

property descp:
Description

Luxury villa in Bellapais with Veles Property
Bellapais Abbey is called the most striking example of medieval Gothic architecture in Northern Cyprus . Its foundation is attributed to Hugh III – the first king of the Lusignan dynasty. It is known that the king was a very devout man, and also a patron of the arts. In any case, Hugh III donated his own funds for the construction of the abbey. The times of his patronage, without exaggeration, can be called the heyday of the holy palace.
Bellapais Abbey is located in the village of the same name. It is in the foothills of the Besparmak ridge, just a few kilometers from Kyrenia. Our complex will be located in these historical places!
